actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: A joint resolution proposing a balanced budget amendment to the Constitution of the United States.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Requires the Congress, prior to each fiscal year, to adopt a statement in which total Federal outlays do not exceed total receipts, unless a three-fifths vote of both Houses authorizes a specific excess. Prohibits a bill to increase receipts from becoming law unless approved by a three-fifths majority in each House. Directs the President to submit a balanced budget. Sets a permanent limit on the amount of Federal public debt, prohibiting any increase unless legislation enacted by a three-fifths majority of both Houses becomes law. Requires roll call votes in the House and Senate under this amendment.

titles.title: A joint resolution proposing a balanced budget amendment to the Constitution of the United States.
